title: Professional Training Course for Assessment and Management of Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational medical knowledge, human anatomy, and physiology understanding
context.additional_context: Performing real clinical case analysis and resolution projects through PBL in a smartphone-based learning environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the etiology, diagnostic criteria, and treatment protocols for Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV) with 80% accuracy
Learners can perform core assessment/intervention techniques such as the Dix-Hallpike test and Epley maneuver with over 70% practical accuracy
Students can systematically analyze BPPV patient cases using smart devices and write PBL reports

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
